title: Manchester United news: Virgil van Dijk insists Red Devils' injury situation is 'not ideal'
text:
Virgil van Dijk has admitted that Manchester United's injury situation is 'not ideal' as Liverpool look to heap the pressure on their fierce rivals this weekend. But he is wary of a backlash from the men under pressure at Old Trafford.

Jurgen Klopp's men go into Sunday's clash with the Red Devils unbeaten and a win for Liverpool at the Theatre of Dreams will be the stuff of nightmares for United supporters.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer suffered a double injury blow after learning that goalkeeper David de Gea and midfielder Paul Pogba would likely miss the clash at Old Trafford.

Virgil van Dijk says Manchester United's injury situation is 'not ideal' going into Sunday's clash

While the situation may not be ideal for United, Van Dijk insists that he and his team-mates are only focused on themselves going into the huge clash.

'For them, it is not the ideal situation to lose your first-choice goalkeeper, one of the best in the world, and one of their main midfielders,' Van Dijk told Sky Sports. 'They will be disappointed but for us, we just want to focus on ourselves.

'They want to bounce back for all they've done this season and it's not what they've wanted so far, but we want to go out there and extend our points tally and keep winning.

David de Gea suffered a groin injury during Spain's Euro 2020 qualifier against Sweden

Midfielder Paul Pogba is definitely ruled out of Sunday's match with leaders Liverpool

'They're not in the best way, they're not fully confident and they're not in the situation they want to be in. But the good thing about football is you can bounce back in any game.

'They might think this is the best occasion to bounce back from it but we know that. We want to go out and fight for every metre on the pitch and try and take the three points back to Liverpool.'

League leaders Liverpool are currently 15 points ahead of their old rivals, with United sitting 12th in the table.
